value.title: Applying color banding by document number in Power BI
value.excerpt: This video describes how to use conditional formatting with a DAX expression to color the rows of a table in Power BI based on the order number instead of using the alternate rows color formatting option. Article and download: https://sql.bi/661744?aff=yt
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/TwUKVrY8KE0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Avoiding circular dependency errors in DAX
value.excerpt: Learn how to avoid circular dependency errors in DAX! Article and download: https://sql.bi/59891/?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/?aff=yt
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/m-qhcDcNKrE" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Chart friendly date table in Power BI
value.excerpt: Create a Date table in Power BI with a small number of columns by leveraging custom format strings to control the chart visualization and the sort order. Article and download: https://sql.bi/676047?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/?aff=yt
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/M14HX0c3jvo" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Choosing between Date or Integer to represent dates in Power BI and Tabular
value.excerpt: This video provides you with the technical knowledge to choose between using a Date or an Integer to create the relationship between your fact table and the Date dimension. Article and download: https://sql.bi/717512?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/DKNS1fCp-zQ" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Comparing with previous selected time period in DAX
value.excerpt: This video describes how you can create a comparison with the previous time period in a visualization, regardless of whether the time periods are consecutive or not: https://sql.bi/526183/?aff=yt (Optimizing duplicated DAX expressions using variables)  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/JBN-x2duxSU" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Computing a measure in DAX Studio
value.excerpt: You can use DAX Studio to evaluate one or more measures in your data model. This is the first step to write, test, and debug your DAX measures in a productive manner.  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/kAniA_N7sB8" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Connecting Excel to Power BI Desktop using DAX Studio
value.excerpt: You can connect Excel to Power BI Desktop copying the connection string from Power BI Desktop. Useful to test your model for Excel consumption before publishing to Power BI service.
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/MVuEzcK0Rag" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Controlling drillthrough in Excel PivotTables connected to Power BI or Analysis Services
value.excerpt: Learn how to customize the drillthrough experience in Excel PivotTables connected to Power BI datasets or Analysis Services databases. Article and download: https://sql.bi/726459?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/?aff=yt
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/h4woNGohUBo" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Counting working days in DAX
value.excerpt: This video describes a DAX technique to compute the number of working days between two dates. Article and download: https://sql.bi/80301
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/JgeUhXkxXbU" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Create Static Tables in DAX Using the DATATABLE Function
value.excerpt: The DATATABLE function can create static tables in a Power BI model specifying column names and data types. Article and download: https://sql.bi/27271/?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/?aff=yt

value.title: Creating a calculated table with DAX Studio
value.excerpt: Use DAX Studio to write and test the expression for a calculated table in Power BI. How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/yZnl2P9ik9g" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Customize default values for each user in Power BI reports
value.excerpt: Learn how to use calculation groups to define a default set of values for columns in your model. Different users can have different default values, and yet retain the full capability to select different values. Article and download: https://sql.bi/717242?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/ZHlC55APxPs" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: DAX Puzzle #1
value.excerpt: A small DAX Puzzle to test your DAX knowledge. Be careful, this is a very hard one!

value.title: DAX Puzzle #2
value.excerpt: A small DAX Puzzle to test your DAX knowledge. Is it too easy? (sorry for the audio, backup mic was used this time)

value.title: Disabling auto date-time in Power BI
value.excerpt: This video shows how to disable the date table automatically created by Power BI. Article and download: https://sql.bi/137706
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/xu3uDEHtCrg" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: DIVIDE Performance
value.excerpt: The DIVIDE function in DAX is usually faster to avoid division-by-zero errors than the simple division operator. However, there are exceptions to this rule, described in this video through simple performance analysis. Article and download: https://sql.bi/15381?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/9dz--8bGUEI" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Evaluation of variables in DAX
value.excerpt: Variables in DAX are constants, and this could be very confusing! Watch this video to understand how the evaluation of variables works in DAX. How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/71ERlpfhmwU" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Filtering a measure in DAX Studio
value.excerpt: DAX Studio can evaluate one or more measures in a query. Marco Russo shows how to apply filters to a measure executed in DAX Studio. Continuous learning to improve your productivity!  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/ZIJDv3J9kko" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Finding the slowest measure in a DAX query
value.excerpt: Use DAX Studio to find the slowest measure in a DAX query produced by a Power BI report. How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/ltO1tDL9HQ0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Handling customers with the same name in Power BI
value.excerpt: This video shows how to show different customers with the same name in a Power BI report by using zero-width spaces, thus simplifying the presentation without adding visible characters to make the names unique. Article and download: https://sql.bi/662116?aff=yt
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/HXM76W__0IU" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: How to debug a DAX measure
value.excerpt: Use DAX Studio to run and debug a DAX measure: fix a calculation issue in a more productive environment and then copy the right formula back in Power BI. How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/ VertiPaq Analyzer: https://www.sqlbi.com/tools/vertipaq-analyzer/
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/fU5EQBJDfOM" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: How to enable the Single Value option in a Power BI slicer
value.excerpt: This video describes how to enable the Single Value slicer option in Power BI by adding additional metadata to the model with Tabular Editor. Article and download: https://sql.bi/728090?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/?aff=yt

value.title: How to return 0 instead of BLANK in DAX
value.excerpt: How to force a measure to return zero instead of blank, in order to highlight combinations of attributes with no data.  Article and download: https://sql.bi/713576?aff=yt  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide to DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/books/the-definitive-guide-to-dax-2nd-edition/?aff=yt

value.title: Improving format of DAX code by using DAX Studio
value.excerpt: If it is not formatted... it is not DAX! Use DAX Formatter in DAX Studio and improve your formulas in Power BI! How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/

value.title: Improving the visualization of the result in DAX Studio
value.excerpt: You can improve the format string of the result of a query in DAX Studio. How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/

value.title: Introducing Articles videos
value.excerpt: Videos related to technical articles published on https://www.sqlbi.com  In the description of each video, you can find the link to read the article and download the sample files used in the demos.  The purpose of these videos is to describe the scenario solved in the article and provide additional comments

value.title: Introducing DEFINE COLUMN in DAX queries
value.excerpt: Learn the syntax and the use cases of the DEFINE COLUMN statement in DAX. Article and download: https://sql.bi/696234/?aff=yt This syntax has been introduced in DAX since December 2020 and can be used in DAX queries only.  How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide

value.excerpt: Learn the syntax and the use cases of the DEFINE TABLE statement in DAX. How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/?aff=yt The definitive guide

value.title: Introducing Performance Analyzer in Power BI Desktop
value.excerpt: Performance Analyzer is the first diagnostic tool to find the slower parts of a report. Find the slowest DAX query before starting a deeper investigation using DAX Studio. How to learn DAX: https://www.sqlbi.com/guides/dax/ DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/
